body:
### Summary

Stand-alone/smoke tests should ensure the package's environment is set properly prior to running the tests.

### Rationale

There are some environments and situations (e.g., MacOS) where you cannot run stand-alone tests without first running `spack load` on the associated package.  This is inconvenient at best.

### Description

Spack test should `load` the package's environment settings prior to running the tests.

### Additional information

```
$ spack --version
0.16.2-4030-af2f07852c
```

### General information

- [X] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Stand-alone/smoke tests should not require 'spack load' to work
